title: Dublin Murders viewers are baffled as Cassie comes face-to-face with her lifeless doppelganger
text:
Dublin Murders viewers were left baffled after last night's episode ended with a character coming face-to-face with her lifeless doppelganger.

Detective Cassie Maddox (Sarah Greene), whose true identity is still shrouded in mystery, was left speechless when she discovered the lookalike lying dead in the ruins of an abandoned cottage.

Not only did the woman bear an uncanny resemblance, she also had the same name as the one Maddox used when working undercover, Lexie Madison.

Detective Cassie Maddox (Sarah Greene), whose true identity is still shrouded in mystery, was left speechless when she discovered a doppelganger lying dead in the ruins of a cottage

Fans of the BBC drama, which is based on novels by author Tana French, were quick to pose their own theories on Twitter - with many admitting they have 'no clue' what is happening

Fans of the BBC drama, which is based on novels by author Tana French, were quick to pose their own theories on Twitter - with a cursed twin, stolen identity and superanatural happenings all offered up as possible explanations.

However others were simply left confused by the complicated plot, with one joking it has 'more twists and turns than an Irish country road'.

One tweeted: 'At first I LOVED #DublinMurders but now I have totally lost the plot; what the hell is going on???'

Eerie: Not only did the dead woman (right) bear an uncanny resemblance to the detective (left), she also had the same name as the one Maddox used when working undercover

Viewers are gripped by the show but some admitted they are confused by the complicated plot, with one joking it has 'more twists and turns than an Irish country road'

Another added: '#DublinMurders is insanely good but confusing. Is Cassie Jamie? She made a comment earlier on “We both got out alive” Watching most of it behind the cushion though...!'

A third wrote: 'I am glad to see that everyone else is a) loving #DublinMurders whilst b) being utterly confused as to what is going on and who everyone is.'

Last week it was revealed that Cassie's police partner Rob Reilly (Killian Scott) was formerly known as Adam, who went missing as a child alongside two friends, Jamie and Peter.

Viewers took to Twitter to swap their theories - and ask other fans for clarity on the plot

However he has chosen to keep his real identity secret from his partner, with whom he is otherwise close.

Fans later discovered that Cassie is also hiding her real identity from her partner, although it is not yet clear why.

Elsewhere Maddox and Reilly caught Dr Mark Hanley (Jonathan Forbes) dancing naked in the woods.

Dublin Murders continues tonight at 9pm on BBC1
description: Fans were left reeling when detective Cassie Maddox (Sarah Greene) discovered the lookalike lying dead in the ruins of an abandoned cottage in a dramatic Dublin Murders cliffhanger.
